titleStmt.title: Promise This -- When You be Dying --

publicationStmt.p: The Poems of Emily Dickinson, Johnson, 1955

lg.l: Promise This -- When You be Dying --
Some OneSome One Some shall summon Me --
Mine belong Your latest Sighing --
Mine -- to Belt Your Eye --
Not with Coins -- though they be Minted
From an Emperor's Hand --
Be my lips -- the only Buckle
Your meek --meek -- low Eyes -- demand --
Mine to stay -- when all have wandered --
To devise once more
If the Life be too surrendered --
Life of Mine -- restore --
Poured like this -- My Whole Libation --
Just that You should see
Bliss of Death -- Life's Bliss surpass in More resembling You --surpass in More resembling You -- extol thro
More resembling YouMore resembling You Imitating You --
Mine -- to guard Your Narrow Precinct --
To entice --entice -- persuadepersuade seduce the Sun
latestlatest Longest on Your South, to linger,
newest --newest -- freshestfreshest Largest Dews of Morn
To demand, in Your low favor
Lest the Jealous Grass
Greener lean -- Or later lingerlater linger fonder cluster
Round some other face --
Mine to supplicate Madonna --
If Madonna be
Could regard so scarce a Creature --Could regard so scarce a Creature -- Could regardregard behold so small --small -- dimdim far a Creature --
Christ -- omitted -- Me --
StillStill Just to follow Your dear feature --
Ne'er so far behind --
For My Heaven --
Of All Her Glories --Of All Her Glories -- Had I not been
Worthiest -- to have gained --Worthiest -- to have gained -- Amplest --Amplest -- Most enough -- denied?
